title: Retired cop shot dead by terrorists while offering namaz in Jammu and Kashmir’s mosque | India News - News9live
text: Baramulla: A retired police officer was shot dead by terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir’s Baramulla district on Sunday. The terrorists fired upon Mohammad Shafi, a retired senior superintendent of police, when he was offering namaz at a mosque in Gantmulla area of north Kashmir’s Baramulla this morning. The area has been cordoned off after the incident and a search operation has been launched to track down the terrorists, police said, adding further details were awaited. “Terrorists fired upon Shri Mohd Shafi, a retired police officer, at Gantmulla, Sheeri Baramulla, while praying Azan in the mosque and succumbed to injuries,” the Kashmir Zone Police said in a post on X. The deceased was 72 -years- old and is survived by his wife, two sons and a daughter. Further details awaited. [@JmuKmrPolice] — Kashmir Zone Police (@KashmirPolice) [December 24, 2023] STORY | Retired police officer shot dead by militants in J-K’s Baramulla READ: [https://t.co/ThGNNaXvIx] VIDEO: [pic.twitter.com/l01QpgH2gt] — Press Trust of India (@PTI_News) [December 24, 2023] The Valley has been witnessing a surge in incidents of targeted attacks on cops in the last few months, prompting the security forces to step up their vigil and intensify the checking of vehicles and suspicious movement of people. There has been a spike in infiltration attempts by terrorists. Today’s attack comes three days after heavily armed terrorists ambushed two Army vehicles at a blind curve at Dhatyar Morh between Dhera Ki Gali and Bufliaz, killing five Army personnel and injuring two others. The terrorists attacked the security personnel when they were moving to an ongoing search operation in the general area of Dhera Ki Gali in the Thanamandi-Surankote region.
